title: UK weather forecast: Downpours ease as Britain braces for fog patches and frosts
text:

The wet weather conditions will slowly clear up this weekend as temperatures stay in the low teens with sunshine.

It is best to gear up with wellies and windproof jackets as heavy showers continue to hit regions over Wales and southwest England today.

A persistent band of rain will fall on southern Scotland and northeast England.

Forecasters said cold, chilly weather remains over the weekend as the mercury stays around 8C to 15C throughout the day.

Met Office meteorologist Aidan McGivern told Daily Express : "The wet weather that we've seen plenty of recently will ease through Saturday.

(Image: PA)

"In those areas that starts the day with rain, showers replace the rain and then actually through that weekend increasingly drier and brighter skies.

"Showers continue to drive into western parts of Wales, the southwest of England and northern England as well but actually for the midlands, for central southern England, east Anglia, the southeast, plenty of blue skies to begin the day.

"There will be showers popping up just about anywhere through the day, especially into the afternoon.

"Brighter skies into the rest of Scotland and that results in clear skies overnight on Saturday."

Overnight frost and early fog patches are expected to hit the southern part of England as soon as tonight.

Met Office Five-day forecast

Today:

Sunny spells and showers. The heaviest and most frequent showers probably over Wales and southwest England, whilst parts of southern Scotland and northeast England will see some more persistent rain. Windy for Scotland.

Tonight:

Showers becoming confined to the coasts of northern UK and perhaps the far southwest of England and Wales. Elsewhere, a chilly night with some fog patches in the south.

Sunday:

Patchy fog, slowly clearing. Then dry with sunny spells for most. A few showers across Scotland and northeast England. Windy in north.

Monday to Wednesday:

More settled than of late with some overnight frosts along with early fog patches. Rain likely in the far southeast at times. Turning unsettled again from the northwest during midweek.
description: Heavy showers will hit the southwest regions but it will ease and clear up through Saturday
